actions.text: Amendment SA 216 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

Amendment SA 216 proposed by Senator Gregg for Senator Snowe. (consideration: CR S2941-2942; text as modified: CR S2942) To increase funding for the SBA's programs such as Microloans, Small Business Development Centers, Women's Business Centers, the HUBZone program and other small business programs and to offset the cost through a reduction in funds under function 150 for foreign microloans and other programs.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 216 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 216 proposed by Senator Gregg for Senator Snowe.

purpose: To increase funding for the SBA's programs such as Microloans, Small Business Development Centers, Women's Business Centers, the HUBZone program and other small business programs and to offset the cost through a reduction in funds under function 150 for foreign microloans and other programs.
